titleStmt.title: Sermo secularis. Or, A sermon to bring to remembrance the dealings of Jehovah with this kingdom of England, and our ingratitude and dis-loyalty to him, in this last century of years. Ab anno nativitatis Christi, 1547. usque ad pr√¶sentem annum, 1647. The time of the ruine of Rome, is herein according to Gods Word modestly pointed at. With sundry uses seasonable and sutable for all degrees and sorts of people. / Preached at Belstead, neer Ipswich, July 4, 1647. By Benjamin Hubbard, preacher of the Word of God at Copdock in Suffolke.
titleStmt.author: Hubbard, Benjamin.

publicationStmt.publisher: Printed by R.L. for Nathanael Webb, and William Grantbam [i.e. Grantham], at the Signe of the Greyhound in Pauls Church-yard,

notesStmt.note: Reproduction of the original in the British Library.
